sequence.caption: Welcome. I’ll guide you through your measurement step by step.
Take a moment to settle in and find a comfortable seated position.
This measurement uses tiny changes in blood flow at your fingertip.
Each time your heart beats, those changes are detected by your phone’s camera and light.
Because the signal is very subtle, movement, cold fingers, or poor placement can affect accuracy.
I’ll help you find the right position.
Cold fingers reduce blood flow and can interfere with the signal.
If your hands feel very cold, cancel the measurement and warm them under water for a few seconds before trying again.
When you’re ready, place your phone face-down on a table.
sequence.notes: After this line, the UI should transition to the face-down measurement experience.

sequence.caption: Now place your fingertip gently over the camera closest to the flash.
Cover the camera completely, without covering the flash.
